definition: notably out of the ordinary, any nonverbal action or gesture that encodes a message, be a signal for or a symptom of
details:
adjective
- notably out of the ordinary
= example: notably out of the ordinary
noun
- any nonverbal action or gesture that encodes a message
= example: any nonverbal action or gesture that encodes a message
= synonyms: sign, signaling
- any incitement to action
= example: any incitement to action
- an electric quantity (voltage or current or field strength) whose modulation represents coded information about the source from which it comes
verb
- be a signal for or a symptom of
= synonyms: point, bespeak, indicate, betoken
- communicate silently and non-verbally by signals or signs
= synonyms: sign, signalise, signalize
